label: 斎宮
本: The Clear Mirror:  A Chronicle of Japanese Court During the Kamakura Period, (1185-1333) . Stanford University Press . 1998
説明文: The high priestess of the Grand Shrines of Ise, selected from among unmarried princesses at the start of each reign. After being nominated, the saigu and the similarly chosen Kamo Virgin (saiin), the chief priestess of the Kamo Shrine moved into the imperial palace compound for a stay of several months. Each then proceeded to her own shrine in the fields" (nonomiya, dwellings situated in Saga [saigū] and Murasakino [saiin] for an extended period of residence. Elaborate purifications, usually in the Kamo River, preceded the moves to the palace and the shrine in the fields. McCullough 1994: 481. [伊勢神宮 斎院 野宮 紫野 鴨川 加茂川]"
